subject: Dear, Fund Beneficiary,
body:
Dear, Fund Beneficiary,
This is to inform you that in the course of my investigation as
director of payment verification / implementation committee I came
across your name as unpaid fund beneficiary in the record of the
central bank of Nigeria and other banks that are supposed to get your
funds amounting on the sum of $6,700,000.00 (Six million seven hundred
thousand united states dollars) released to you. My committee was set
up by the payment reconciliation committee to verify and scrutinize
all outstanding debts owed to our foreign beneficiaries in accordance
with the information received from the United States government and
other countries over unpaid huge debts owed to Foreigners.
Get back to me on 
ariwokayode21@gmail.com
 as soon as you receive this
message for more directives and get the deduction done to enable you
to get your payment released in your account.
Yours sincerely,
Olukayode Ariwoola  (CJN)
CHIEF JUSTICE FEDERAL
REPUBLIC OF NIGERIA
PHONE: +234-91-2082-5362

subject: Re:   Dear, Fund Beneficiary,
body:
Hello Olukayode Ariwoola CJN,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I must say, this is quite a surprise! I wasn't aware of any unpaid funds in my name. Could you please provide more details about this? How did my name come up in the records of the Central Bank of Nigeria and other banks?

I'm also curious about the process involved in releasing these funds. What kind of directives are we talking about here? And what does it mean to get the deduction done?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Robert
